content:
WcfExceptionHandler Class

Definition

This class provide handling of WCF exceptions encountered in communicating with a service fabric service that is using WCF based communication listener.

In this Article

public class WcfExceptionHandler : Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Services.Communication.Client.IExceptionHandler
Inheritance
Object
WcfExceptionHandler

Remarks

The exceptions are handled as per the description below:

            The following exceptions indicate service failover. These exceptions are handled by returning  from the 
             method.
            The  property of the  is set to false, 
            the   property is set to a random value up to  
            and  property is set to .

            The following exceptions indicate transient error conditions and handled by returning  from the 
             method.
            The  property of the  is set to true, 
            the   property is set to a random value up to  
            and  property is set to .

            The following exceptions indicate mismatch in the binding or contract between the client and the service. 
            These exceptions are handled by returning  from the 
             method.

            The following exceptions are indicate an error from the service. 
            They are handled by returning  from the 
             method.

            All other exceptions that are , but not  are handled by returning 
             from the 
             method.
            The  property of the  is set to true, 
            the   property is set to a random value up to  
            and  property is set to .

Constructors

WcfExceptionHandler()

Initializes a new instance of WcfExceptionHandler class.

Methods

IExceptionHandler.TryHandleException(ExceptionInformation, OperationRetrySettings, ExceptionHandlingResult)

Method that examines the exception and determines how that exception can be handled.
